response.overview: Totoi lives with his grandfather Bobore in Iaja, an ecovillage built on a promontory overlooking the open sea. The two have specific roles within the community in which they live: the grandfather is the guardian of the village and the only person alive who keeps alive the art of weaving bisso, sea silk, the only fiber that can be used to create the special nets used for fishing during s’orbesciu, the most heartfelt ritual in the entire community. The young man, on the other hand, is not interested in inheriting his grandfather’s art but is instead attracted to the sea and, above all, to what lies beyond the horizon he sees every day. His curiosity creates a constant conflict with Bobore, which will end on the night of s’orbesciu, when the two will make a choice from which there will be no turning back.
response.title: Enna
